task_summary: Place down the maroon cube from the gripper onto the table surface and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows multiple small objects on a white table and a robot arm centered over a maroon cube. The goal is to release the maroon cube onto the table in a controlled manner. The robot should start with the cube already grasped, approach the chosen place zone at the table center, align, lower until contact is detected, open the gripper to release, and then retreat to clear the object. No special precision or speed constraints are stated beyond a standard, careful placement.
preconditions: Maroon cube is currently held in the gripper
A clear place zone exists on the table
Workspace is free of obstacles along the retreat path
stepwise_plan: Move above the target place zone with a small vertical offset.
Refine approach and alignment over the place zone.
Lower until contact with the table is detected.
Open gripper to release the cube.
Retreat to a safe distance from the placed cube.
success_criteria: Cube rests stably on the table within the intended area
Gripper clears the object without collisions
failure_and_recovery: If object not in gripper: re-acquire grasp (outside current tree).
If contact not detected: retry a shallow lower, then re-align.
If cube tips during release: re-grasp and attempt again with reduced speed.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after successful release and retreat, or after action timeouts/failures are reported.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Confirms the robot starts with the maroon cube grasped.
Positions the TCP above the designated place zone.
Descends until table contact is detected.
Backs away to avoid collisions after placement.

failure_modes: Object not actually in gripper at start
Misalignment causes cube to tip or land partly off target zone
No contact sensed due to sensor noise or soft collision
Gripper fails to open or opens too little
Collision with nearby objects during retreat
recovery_strategy: If not held, branch to re-pick routine (not modeled here).
Re-run align step with tighter tolerance and repeat descent.
Increase force_threshold slightly and retry lower with smaller max_depth.
Open gripper wider and add a brief wait before retreat.
Plan a higher retreat distance if clutter is detected.
assumptions: Robot begins with the maroon cube already grasped.
Place zone is the table center visible in frames; no explicit pose key provided.
No special force/precision modifiers are specified in the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Cube ends up flat on the table inside the place zone
No secondary motion of other objects from contact
